Experimental.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**********************************************************************
00002 
00003   Audacity: A Digital Audio Editor
00004 
00005   Experimental.h
00006 
00007   Dominic Mazzoni
00008   James Crook
00009 
00010   Used for includes and #defines for experimental features.
00011 
00012   When the features become mainstream the include files will 
00013   move out of here and into the files which need them.  The
00014   #defines will then be retired.
00015 
00016 
00017 
00018   JKC: This file solves a problem of how to avoid forking the
00019   code base when working on new features e.g:
00020     - Additional displays in Audacity
00021     - Modular architecture.
00022   Add #defines in here for the new features, and make your code
00023   conditional on those #defines.
00024 
00025 **********************************************************************/
00026

00045 //Next line enables Mic monitoring at times when it was previously off.

00047 //unwanted record-cursor on the wave track.

00053 
00054 // Effect categorisation. Adds support for arranging effects in categories
00055 // and displaying those categories as submenus in the Effect menu.
00056 // This was a 2008 GSoC project that was making good progress at the half-way point
00057 // but then the student didn't contribute after that.  It needs a bit of work to finish it off.
00058 // As a minimum, if this is turned on for a release,
00059 // it should have an easy mechanism to disable it at run-time, such as a menu item or a pref,
00060 // preferrably disabled until other work is done.  Martyn 22/12/2008.
00061 //#define EFFECT_CATEGORIES
00062 
00063 // Andreas Micheler, 20.Nov 2007: 
00064 // A spectrumLogF-like view mode with notes quantization.
00065 // Just select the "Find Notes" checkbox in the spectrum prefs 
00066 // to activate it instead of the Spectrum log(f) mode.
00067 //#define EXPERIMENTAL_FIND_NOTES
00068 
00069 // AM, 22.Nov 2007
00070 // Skip Points support in the spectrum view mode.
00071 //#define EXPERIMENTAL_FFT_SKIP_POINTS
00072 
00073 // AM, 22.Nov 2007: 
00074 // A Frequency Grid for the Spectrum Log(f) & Find Notes modes
00075 //#define EXPERIMENTAL_FFT_Y_GRID
00076 
00077 // Andy Coder, 03.Mar 2009:
00078 // Allow keyboard seeking before initial playback position
00079 //#define EXPERIMENTAL_SEEK_BEHIND_CURSOR
00080 
00081 // Michael Chinen, 08.Oct 2009
00082 // Use on-demand importing for FLAC. Has issues with opening projects that
00083 // have not been fully imported in builds without FLAC support, so disabled for
00084 // 2.0 release
00085 //#define EXPERIMENTAL_OD_FLAC
00086 
00087 // Philip Van Baren 01 July 2009
00088 // Replace RealFFT() and PowerSpectrum function to use (faster) RealFFTf function
00089 #define EXPERIMENTAL_USE_REALFFTF
00090 
00091 // RBD, 1 Sep 2008

00103 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_FEATURES
00104    // The first experimental feature is a notebook that adds
00105    // a tabbed divider to the project.
00106    //#define EXPERIMENTAL_NOTEBOOK
00107    // The notebook in turn can contain:
00108    // 1. The Nyquist Inspector, which is a browser for the objects in 
00109    // Audacity.
00110    //#define EXPERIMENTAL_NYQUIST_INSPECTOR
00111    // 2. The Vocal Studio, a screen for working with vocal sounds
00112    // particularly vowel sounds.
00113    //#define EXPERIMENTAL_VOCAL_STUDIO
00114    // 3. The Audacity Tester is an extended version of the benchmarks
00115    // display.  The crucial idea is to be able to compare waveforms
00116    // where effects have been applied by audacity but using different 
00117    // block-sizes.  This should give high confidence that we don't
00118    // suffer from end-effects on buffers, e.g. losing one sample on
00119    // each buffer.
00120    //#define EXPERIMENTAL_AUDACITY_TESTER
00121 
00122    // A long term plan is to use dso's and dlls for Audacity extensions
00123    // These are 'WX' plug ins that manage their own displays using
00124    // wxWidgets.
00125    //#define EXPERIMENTAL_WX_PLUG_INS
00126 #endif
00127 
00128 //If you want any of these files, ask JKC.  They are not
00129 //yet checked in to Audacity SVN as of 12-Feb-2010
